titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, Lewis E 175: Prayer against the plague; Prayer book

notesStmt.note: Portion of the prayers written backwards
De Ricci, Seymour, with the assistance of W. J. Wilson, Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada, vol. 2 (New York,: H. W. Wilson, 1935-40), p. 2043, no. 175.

Free Library of Philadelphia, A Descriptive Catalogue of the John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts in the Free Library of Philadelphia, compiled by Edwin Wolf, 2nd, with an introduction by Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach (Philadelphia: The Free Library, 1937), pp. 187-89, no. 175 (+ Supplement).
TELMA-Luxury Bound: A corpus of manuscripts illustrated in the Netherlands (1400-1550)

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript contains a late 15th-century prayer book in Latin with headings in Italian.

msItem.title: Prayer against the plague; Prayer book

supportDesc.extent: i+121+iii; 76 x 52 mm bound to 78 x 58 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto, and inconsistent modern foliation in pencil lower right recto

collation.p: Structure uncertain; appears to have been originally quired in gatherings of 12

layoutDesc.layout: One column of fifteen lines; written area: 47 x 35 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Thirty-one full page miniatures in gold and colors with borders containing human figures, beasts, mottoes, and flowers; three full-page borders; one historiated initial; nine decorated and illuminated initials with foliate borders; illuminated initials in text; one half-page tau cross; two-line initials in red and blue throughout; rubrication throughout; decorative pen flourishes and faces in the margins; over fifty smaller initials, some within full page borders, most in colors on a gold ground
26rDecorated initial with foliate border, Initial S
27vDecorated initial with foliate border, Initial D
43rDecorated initial and foliate border, Initial A
56rDecorated initial with foliate border, Initial B
61rDecorated initial with foliate border, Initial O

binding.p: 17th century blind tooled calf panels inlaid in the sides, brown morocco back, gilt edges, in brown morocco case

history.provenance: Thomas F. Richardson, Boston; sold to John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia, 1919; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936
